text: Dańczów () is a village in the administrative district of Gmina Lewin Kłodzki, within Kłodzko County, Lower Silesian Voivodeship, in south-western Poland. It lies approximately east of Lewin Kłodzki, west of Kłodzko, and south-west of the regional capital Wrocław. Prior to 1945 it was in Germany. After World War II the region was placed under Polish administration according to the post-war Potsdam Agreement as part of the Recovered Territories. The native German populace was expelled and replaced with Poles from the Eastern Borderlands. ==References== Category:Villages in Kłodzko County
title: Dańczów
